subject: Negotiation
title: Researching the Other Side
description: A short lesson to help you apply Researching the Other Side.

hook.text: A car buyer who knows the dealer's invoice price gets $1,200 better deals on average.

buildup.text: Research means understanding their constraints, pressures, deadlines, and alternatives.

discovery.text: Quarterly reports, job postings, and social media reveal more than people think.

twist.text: The person with more information almost always gets the better deal.

climax.text: Ten minutes of research before a negotiation can shift thousands in your favor.

punchline.text: Information is leverage. Ignorance is expensive.

quiz.question: Why is researching the other side so important?
options: The person with more information gets better deals
It's only useful in formal business settings
